headline: Datadog to Join the S&P 500. The Stock Is Soaring After Hours.
summary: On Wednesday after the close of trading, S&P Dow Jones Indices announced that  Datadog  would replace Juniper Networks on the  index beginning on July 9.  Juniper was acquired by  Hewlett Packard Enterprise  earlier in the day.  Datadog stock is up around 9% in late trading following the announcement.

headline: Datadog to join S&P 500, replacing Juniper Networks
summary: Investing.com -- Datadog Inc (NASDAQ:DDOG). will be added to the S&P 500 index, replacing Juniper Networks Inc (NYSE:JNPR)., according to an announcement made by S&P Dow Jones Indices on Wednesday.

raw.headline: Datadog to join S&P 500, replacing Juniper Networks

headline: Datadog Set to Join S&P 500
summary: Datadog Inc. (NASD: DDOG) will replace Juniper Networks Inc. (NYSE: JNPR) in the S&P 500 effective prior to the opening of trading on Wednesday, July 9. S&P 500 constituent Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. (NYSE: HPE) acquired Juniper Networks on July 2.

headline: Palantir: Let's Be Honest, It's Time To Sell (Downgrade)
summary: Palantir's forward EV/Revenue, price-to-sales, and EV/EBITDA ratios are at unsustainable levels, requiring massive growth to justify current prices. Learn more on PLTR stock here.

headline: Got $1,000? 2 Top Growth Stocks to Buy That Could Double Your Money
summary: Micron is seeing surging demand for high-bandwidth memory in data centers -- a market expected to explode over the next decade.  Large organizations are starting to adopt Datadog's cloud observability tools, positioning the stock for a bull run.  Technology has historically been the place to look for quality growth stocks.
